definition: margin/leeway
extra/surplus/remaining/remainder after division/(following numerical value) or more/in excess of (some number)/residue (math.)/after/I/me
surname Yu
(archaic) I/me/variant of 餘|余[yu2], surplus
earth/ground/field/place/land/CL:片[pian4]
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct
to leave some leeway/to allow for the unpredictable
to leave room to maneuver/to leave a margin for error
leeway/latitude/room for freedom of action
to have room to save a situation/margin for error (idiom)

sentences.english: Planning to use every minute of those 8 hours working is not leaving any margin.
sentences.chinese: 计划充分利用8小时里的每一分钟就是不留任何余地。

sentences.english: No such thing as a back-flow of ideas exists any more than there exists a return of a river on its course.
sentences.chinese: 思想并不比江河有更多倒退的余地。

sentences.english: Be sure there’s spaces between things, so you’re not rushed.
sentences.chinese: 要确保每件事之间都留有余地，这样你就不会太匆忙。

sentences.english: The skip bombs were fused at fifteen seconds there was no room for error.
sentences.chinese: 跳弹的引信只有15秒，没有任何出错的余地。

sentences.english: This gives me some starting and stopping leeway.
sentences.chinese: 这会给我一些开始和停顿的时间余地。

sentences.english: Unfortunately, a small kitchen has limited options for improvement.
sentences.chinese: 遗憾的是，一个小厨房没有多大的改进余地。

sentences.english: And would you ask if the rent is still negotiable or not?
sentences.chinese: 还有，可不可以问问租金是否仍有商量余地呢？

sentences.english: Though you need to make room for failure, you shouldn't just fail.
sentences.chinese: 虽然你需要给失败留余地，但你不应该只是失败。

sentences.english: But economic problems at home can also make people feel they have few other choices.
sentences.chinese: 但海内的经济问题也会使人们感到抉择余地未几。

sentences.english: All of these are undebatable facts.
sentences.chinese: 这些全都是无辩论余地的事实。

sentences.english: There is no any room for argument on that point.
sentences.chinese: 在争论这问题上不留余地。

sentences.english: We ourselves, of course, have no choice whatsoever in the matter.
sentences.chinese: 我们自己，当然没有任何选择的余地。

sentences.english: The shop offers a large choice of hats and shoes.
sentences.chinese: 这家商店的鞋帽样式繁多，可供选择的余地很大。

sentences.english: For those without relatives to take them in, there are few options.
sentences.chinese: 那些没有亲戚可以投奔的寡妇则很少有选择的余地。

sentences.english: In fact they have a slightly wider choice than the Lanton.
sentences.chinese: 事实上它们比兰顿选择余地要大一点。

sentences.english: No, I'm afraid this is non-negotiable.
sentences.chinese: 不，我很抱歉，但这事没有商量余地。

definition: leeway/latitude/room for freedom of action
to save or redeem (a situation)/to mediate/to intercede
to have room to save a situation/margin for error (idiom)
a way out/a way to retreat/leeway
through road/way out/way to survive/means of subsistence
labor/physical work
to move aside/to get out of the way/to back down/to concede
to leave room to maneuver/to leave a margin for error
to leave some leeway/to allow for the unpredictable
odds of success/stratagem that ensures success/to be sure of success
energy left over (to do sth else)
it may be said
to have misgivings/apprehension/worry/qualm/scruple
to concede/to give in/to yield/a concession/(linguistics) concessive
escape route/retreat route/communication lines to the rear/alternative course of action/room for maneuver
to compromise/to reach terms/a compromise
necessary/essential/indispensable/required
